TITLE.P: 74965 US KLM MBK Extraction and real-time PCR

SHORT_DESCR.P: A fully automated DNA/RNA extractor shall be procured for different patient samples, primarily EDTA full blood, for further genetic analyses. We would like to have an automated system that also handles pipetting primary samples for extraction and set-up of PCR.

A block based (96/384) real-time PCR shall be procured for different molecular biological analyses. The instrument must be compatible with FRET probes, TaqMan probes and SYBR green in addition to High Resolution Melting (HRM).

A fully automated DNA/RNA extractor shall be procured for different patient samples, primarily EDTA full blood, for further genetic analyses. We would like to have an automated system that also handles pipetting primary samples for extraction and set-up of PCR.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Framework agreement for instrument specific consumables and an option for a service contract. See the tender documentation.

SHORT_DESCR.P: A block based (96/384) real-time PCR shall be procured for different molecular biological analyses. The instrument must be compatible with FRET probes, TaqMan probes and SYBR green in addition to High Resolution Melting (HRM).

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Framework agreement for instrument specific consumables and an option for a service contract. See the tender documentation.

SUITABILITY.P: Norwegian tenderers shall have their tax, payroll tax and VAT payments in order, a tax and VAT certificate.

The certificates shall be issued on a certified form from the tax collector/tax office (www.skatteetaten.no). The certificates must be no more than 6 months from the deadline for receipt of tenders. Any arrears must be explained/justified.

Foreign tenderers must submit corresponding confirmation that government taxes and fees have been paid in the country where the tenderer has its registered place of business, in accordance with the respective country's rules for such certificates.
Tenderers shall have ethically responsible activity.

If during the past 5 years the tenderer has been convicted of corruption, fraud or money laundering, or has committed criminal offences concerning professional conduct, the judgement and case must be accounted for. To be stated in the Tender Letter.
The tenderer shall be a legally established company.
Norwegian tenderers must provide an updated company registration certificate.
Foreign companies: Verification showing that the tenderer is registered in a company register, professional register or a commerce register in the country where the tenderer is established.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The tenderer shall have sufficient economic and financial solidity to fulfil the contract obligations.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Credit evaluation/rating, not older than 3 months, based on the last known accounting figures. The rating shall be conducted by a credit rating agency with a licence to carry out credit appraisal.
A creditworthiness without guarantee will be sufficient for complying with the requirement.

If a tenderer has a justifiable cause to not present the documentation that the Contracting Authority has requested, he can document his economic and financial capacity by presenting other documents that the Contracting Authority deem to be appropriate. (FoA § 16-4 (2)).

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Tenderers shall have the necessary technical and professional qualifications to fulfil the contractual obligations. The Public Procurement Regulations §16-5.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Tenderers shall document a quality assurance system that documents the tenderer's organisation and ability for carrying out a good delivery. Enclose a short description (or example Table of Contents) of the tenderer's quality system/methods for quality assurance, and a copy of any certificates.

Tenderers shall document the organisation's technical and professional qualifications. Enclose a detailed description of the tenderer's organisation, both the sales and service organisation, medical technological area of operations, Strategy and Procurement, Page 11 of 18 including an organisation chart. The document shall also include the name, competence and relevant experience for employees who will participate in this delivery and for those who shall carry out service and maintenance after delivery. State where the tenderer´s service organisation is located.

Description of the tenderer's up to 3 most relevant contracts in the course of the last 3 years. The project description must include a specification of the project value, project length and state the Customer (name, phone and email). The Contractor is responsible for documenting the projects’ relevance through their description. The contractor may do this by including documentation on the skill or experience of the personnel that can be used for this project, including skills or experience that has been acquired while the personnel was in the service of another employer.
